div.h1: Covid19 Virus and Colbert County Schools FAQ

h2.a: Colbert County School's Academic Continuity Plan

td.p:
Colbert County Board of Education
COVID-19 Crisis
For assistance…256.483.5129.
RECAP of Activities:
A grab n go will be set up at each school (drive thru).

strong.em: DO NOT GET out of your vehicle.

br.br:
Bags will be delivered to your car.
During this time, a food bag, a Chromebook, school packets, and Census 2020 information may be picked up and/or returned.
If you need additional assistance, please let us know.

td.p:
Dr. Gale D. Satchel
Superintendent
256.483.5129
#Shoalsstrong

Colbert County School District is taking the health and well-being of our students and staff very seriously. As a proactive measure, our HealthCare Services and Maintenance Departments are monitoring student illness and providing additional cleaning on our campuses. Additionally, we continue to work closely with the Alabama Department of Public Health (ADPH), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE) for the latest guidance and recommendations regarding Coronavirus (COVID-19), influenza, and other infectious illnesses/diseases.

One-Call-Now is the communication system used to communicate important updates to stakeholders of the Colbert County School District. All stakeholders are encouraged to sign-up for information by visiting www.colbert.k12.al.us or calling 256-483-5129 (Help Desk).

Beginning Monday, April 6th, Colbert County Schools will begin the implementation of a Blended Learning Plan. Each school campus will continue curbside meal distribution on Mondays, from 9:00 a.m. – 11:00 a.m. This service will continue until higher authority prohibits this action and/or the danger of our employees/students become compromised.
We are grateful for the support of our community! The support has been overwhelming and invaluable. Thank you does not resonate the love shown during this time.

For more information about the blended learning plan, academic enrichment activities, please visit the Academic Continuity Plan page and each schools’ social media sites. Also, every teacher has information posted on his/her school web page.
The Help Desk (256-483-5129) is currently available Monday through Friday, from 7:30 a.m. – 4:00 p.m.

#Shoalsstrong
#Teamcolbertcounty
Dr. Gale D. Satchel
Superintendent

h2.a: A Message from Dr. Eric Mackey, Alabama State Superintendent

h2.a: A Message from Dr. Gale Satchel

td.p:
Colbert County Board of Education
COVID-19 Crisis
Central Office
Please Knock on the door or call for assistance 256.483.5129
We will give out food until the last bag has been given away.

br.br:
A grab and go will be set up at the central Office.
Monday, March 23rd, 7:00 am-9:00 am,
A grab and go will be set up at each school (drive thru)
During this time, a Chromebook and school packets may be picked up.
Monday, March 30th, 7:00 am-9:00 am
A grab and go will be set up at each school (drive thru)
During this time, a Chromebook and school packets may be picked up.

td.p: If you need additional assistance, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Dr. Gale Satchel
Superintendent
256.483.5129
#shoalsstrong
Dear Parents,

The Colbert County School system is in close communication with ADPH District Medical Officer Dr. Karen Landers regarding COVID-19. At this time, we have been advised by the Alabama Department of Public Health for Disease Control and Prevention to cancel all school-related events and activities until April 30th.
As we receive information, we will post updates to social media pages and the school website. Dr. Satchel will also call everyone on all-call and leave a detailed message with information.

In the event of school closures, classes will be offered online and Chromebooks will be available for checkout. If your student does not have Wi-Fi, your student may complete assignments that are available for download without an internet connection. Your student may also take home a paper packet with class work.

The health and safety of your students, our campuses, and our communities are of utmost importance. We will continue to remain in close contact with the Alabama Department of Public Health, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

We are prepared with a plan in place to address the need for areas of isolation, food distribution, and various student needs. Please know that the precautionary measures taken are to ensure the overall safety and well-being of all Colbert County students.

For additional information, please contact Dr. Gale Satchel -gsatchel@colbert.k12.al.us ,Lead Nurse Emily Lanier -elanier@colbert.k12.al.us and Family and Community Liaison Chelsea Yarber-cyarber@colbert.k12.al.us.

h2.a: Letter from Dr. Mackey, State Superintendent of Education

td.p: A letter from Dr.Mackey📢

Superintendents,
Under this state of emergency, please excuse any students who are absent from school Monday, March 16, 2020 through Wednesday, March 18, 2020. Expecting high absenteeism, we will be seeking a waiver on attendance for these days for accountability reasons.

Working with the local superintendents in some communities, we have already closed some schools beginning Monday based on potential enhanced threat of exposures in those schools. If you feel like you need to close schools, you have that authority under the executive order, but please notify me as quickly as possible if you do so.
Thank you for your continued diligence,
Eric G. Mackey
State Superintendent of Education

Colbert County Schools wishes to assure our school communities that plans for student meals are currently being formulated with an emphasis on convenience and safety. We continue to get minute-by-minute updates and guidance from the Alabama State Department of Education that assists us in making our best plans. Exact details will come when logistics have been finalized. Your patience and kindness are appreciated. Parents who wish to keep their children at home beginning Monday, March 16th, are welcomed to do so and student absences will be excused up until statewide school closing on Thursday.

However, Monday -Wednesday, we will serve hot meals and have computer devices available to check out.
We will not worry about mid-term exams at this time.
As always, thank you for keeping safety a priority.
#shoalsstrong

div.span: © 2020 Colbert County School District. All Rights Reserved.

div.p: It is the policy of the Colbert County Board of Education that, pursuant to the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) of December 2015 and the Title VII-B of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act of 2001 (42 USC 111431, et seq.), as amended by the ESSA, and each and every other law, rule, regulation or code, regarding a free and appropriate education, all students, regardless of status, placement, shall have equal access to appropriate education, including public preschool education. All students shall be provided the opportunity to attain the challenging content and student performance standards established by the state of Alabama, without stigma or isolation on any basis.
